dt: {bc}marked by the imaginative or emotional appeal of what is heroic, adventurous, remote, mysterious, or idealized
{bc}of, relating to, or having the characteristics of {a_link|romanticism}
{bc}of or relating to music of the 19th century characterized by an emphasis on subjective emotional qualities and freedom of form
{bc}of or relating to a composer of this music
{bc}having an inclination for romance {bc}responsive to the appeal of what is idealized, heroic, or adventurous
{bc}marked by expressions of love or affection
{bc}of, relating to, or constituting the part of the hero especially in a light comedy

et: French {it}romantique{/it}, from obsolete {it}romant{/it} romance, from Old French {it}romanz{/it}
shortdef: consisting of or resembling a romance
having no basis in fact : imaginary
impractical in conception or plan : visionary
